text: guys today's recipe is less of a recipe
and more just like a fun fun idea for
decorating a tart for any of our fun
summer holidays say the fourth of July
it's a star tart for the filling I'm
just gonna make a sweetened ricotta
cheese and you can sweeten it with as
much sugar as you want I'm gonna add
like 3 tablespoons of sugar to one and a
half cups of fresh ricotta cheese a
little bit of lemon zest you can fill
this tart with pastry cream or with
lemon curd whatever it is that you feel
like having in your tart so I'm just
gonna do this because it's no cook right
it's really easy a little bit of lemon
juice stir it together and then this is
going to fill a pre-baked pie crust this
is a blind baked Pat Sucre in a 9 inch
tart pan and we've got lots of videos
online of how to blind bake and how to
make all kinds of pie crusts so go ahead
and look those up if you want to know
how so spread your filling into the tart
take a star cookie cutter this is a
pretty big star cookie cutter and then
place it just a mark in the ricotta or
if you're using pastry cream mark a star
in the top of your tart then fill it in
with berries I'm going to use
blueberries but you can cut little
strawberries and fill it in with that I
like the blueberries because they're
kind of small and you can get a really
good defined shape especially if you
pick the tiniest ones especially if you
can get wild blueberries which I
couldn't get but if you can even more
amazing putting the bigger ones in the
center and just sort of fill in your
tart outlining the shape of the star
which you've marked on your tart with
the berries it's really a cute idea you
can put some of the berries on their
side you can pile them up a little bit
more if you want to cover up more of the
white spots that's up to you this is
sort of a very creative endeavor now you
can kind of go crazy what I like to do
is surround my blueberries with sort of
a circle of raspberries to fill it out
up to
Edge's and as you can see as you're
filling this in the shape of the star
starts sort of popping off the tart it
becomes more obvious once it has its
surrounding of another color of berries
and then for the final layer I'm going
to slice up some strawberries and just
sort of fan them around the edges so
it's at that aside for a second red
strawberries and slice them really nice
and thinly maybe this is enough maybe
not we'll see and then just go back in
so pretty they're like little flower
petals and just keep working your way
around make a really beautiful star
using strawberries as the center of your
tart as well
I'll have pictures of both up online so
you can see them I'm loving it and
smells so good because these
strawberries are amazing
I mean I'm gonna say that I'm not
usually one of those sort of patriotic
desserts kind of people but this one's
both patriotic and delicious so I want
delicious food and this fits the bill
because it's both festive beautiful and
delicious oh and did I mention it's also
super duper easy to make look at that
can you believe how beautiful that is I
am super excited to be able to share
this idea with you please make this tart
and enjoy your summer you are gonna love
it
